Ask them about their daily routines and habits, and observe how they interact with each other and their environment.
Learn about their communication methods and language, and use this knowledge to communicate with them more effectively.
Ask them about their fears, desires, and needs, and try to understand their perspective on life.
Ask them about their social structures and relationships, and learn about their hierarchy and social dynamics.
Ask them about their survival strategies and adaptations, and learn about their evolutionary history and natural history.
